title: Dave Bassett launches scathing attack on the Leicester flops who got Claudio Ranieri sacked
text:
Sport Dave Bassett launches scathing attack on the Leicester flops who got Claudio Ranieri sacked The former Foxes director of football says Schmeichel and Drinkwater are the only players not to have gone backwards Share Bassett has pulled no punches (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Claudio Ranieri went back to Leicester’s training ground yesterday to say his final goodbyes to the players who betrayed him. 
The Italian, who was sacked on Thursday, made a brief visit to Belvoir Drive to say his farewells to his title-winners and club staff. 
Ranieri’s visit came as Leicester’s former director of football Dave Bassett launched a scathing attack on the club’s ‘big-time Charlie’ players and claimed they had gone backwards. 
Bassett accused the title-winners of letting down Ranieri who said on Friday that his “dream died” after he was fired having led the Foxes to an historic Premier League title. Ranieri leaves the Leicester training ground for the last time on Friday (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More "No truth" in players turning against Ranieri, says Schmeichel 
Leicester’s form has nose-dived this season and they sit third from bottom with players unhappy with the 65-year-old Italian’s team selection and tactics. 
And a number of them held meetings with owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha which eventually led to the manager’s dismissal. 
“I don’t speak with anybody, just to say thank you to the fans. They are fantastic. Thank you,” Ranieri said as he drove away yesterday. 
On how he was feeling, he said: “I feel good now, because what we achieved in Leicester – I hope it will happen again, but it will be very difficult.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
